name: Reverse Plank
how_to_perform:
1. Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground, shoulder-width apart.
2. Place your hands under your glutes for support, palms facing down.
3. Lift your hips off the ground while keeping your shoulders relaxed, form a 'reverse' planking position by engaging your lower back muscles to maintain a straight line from head to heels.
4. Pull your belly button towards your spine to activate your core and maintain stability.
5. Hold this position for 30-60 seconds or the desired duration, focusing on maintaining proper alignment and engaging the targeted muscles.
6. Release your body slowly by lowering your hips back down to the starting position.
short_summary: Reverse plank is an exercise that primarily targets the lower back muscles, engaging core stability while performing a modified planking position.
